I t was not anticipated that at date of contract sales by auction would take place in Boston which might establish a precedent for sales say in Yokohama. However it is recognized that His Majesty*s Government is acting in the best interests and under the most trying circumstances consequently Government of Commonwealth of Australia leaves the matter in its hands assured that Commonwealth interests will be duly protected. Government of Cosmonwealth of Australia will be greatly assisted if it could be arranged with Government of United States to prohibit the publication of Australian wool prices in newspapers and all other journals excepting those of an official character and absolutely necessary that those directly engaged in the wool trade even then the official catalogues should be treated as confidential. In Australia it has been found necessary to authorize the chairman of the Central wool Committee to censor all newspaper articles on wool in the interest of the scheme generally particularlyafter South African experiences.MJNRO FERGUSON.a repetition of this passage is being obtained.
